title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-9.6 - Withdrawal of arbitration requests
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-9.6 - Withdrawal of arbitration requests

State Regulations
(a) The parties may, by mutual agreement, withdraw the request for arbitration in writing. The document must be signed by
the parties and filed with the dispute resolution forum. (b) Additionally, the party requesting
arbitration may unilaterally withdraw a request for arbitration by filing such
request for withdrawal with the dispute resolution forum and sending a copy to
all other parties. (c) Where the
request for arbitration has been withdrawn, fees paid to the dispute resolution
forum shall not be refundable. (d) When a request for arbitration is withdrawn prior to receipt of a response from
the opposing party and submission of the request for arbitration to an
arbitrator, no fee shall be due other than the $25 filing fee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12

380-9.6

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
